p: Physical examination at the time of presentation revealed widespread reddish-gray macules of varying sizes with fine scales that were occasionally erythematous but never elevated. These macules were located on her neck, trunk, abdomen (Fig. 2), bilateral antecubital fossa, and posterior legs. Over most of her body, these macular processes were confluent. Histopathologic examination of a biopsy specimen from erythematous macules on the breast demonstrated a superficial, perivascular lymphocytic infiltrate with a vacuolar interface change, exocytosis and pigment incontinence in the papillary dermis, compatible with parapsoriasis en plaque.
